name: Thermal Refugia Availability
functionStatement: Shade, solar input, and groundwater keep temperature and light within natural ranges for stream metabolism and dissolved oxygen.
descriptionMarkdown: Springs or deeper pools temper extremes, unless large daily swings are historically normal (arid ephemeral).
howToMeasureMarkdown: Locate cooler pockets or deeper pools using a field temperature check or loggers where available.

inputs.label: Thermal Refugia Availability
inputs.helpMarkdown: High resolution aerial imagery; Field photos; Brief field recon; Historical evidence

levels.label: Good
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Good: Multiple cooler pockets or deeper pools provide refugia during warm periods. (Suggested index range 0.70-1.0)

levels.label: Fair
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Fair: One or two minor refuges. / Rare or minimal cooler zones. (Suggested index range 0.40-0.69)

levels.label: Poor
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Poor: No refugia where expected. High thermal stress risk. (Suggested index range 0.0-0.39)

references: mapped springs/seeps and baseflow indices (where available).
